title: Education Costs in Barbados
content:
The cost of education in Barbados varies depending on the type of institution, with public schools being generally free or subsidized, while private and international schools can range from $2,000 to $10,000 per year.

[FACTBOX]
Education Spend (% GDP): 3.6%
Literacy Rate: 98%
School System: 11 years of compulsory education
Academic Year: 9 months
Currency: BBD
[/FACTBOX]

[SECTION] Education System Overview [/SECTION]
The education system in Barbados is highly regarded, with a strong emphasis on primary and secondary education. Public schools in Barbados are generally of high quality, with a focus on core subjects such as English, mathematics, and science. The language of instruction is **English**, and education is compulsory for 11 years, from age 5 to 16. Private schools, on the other hand, offer a more exclusive and often specialized education, with some schools focusing on specific areas such as **arts** or **sports**. International schools are also available, catering to the expat community and offering a range of curricula, including **IB** and **Cambridge**.

The quality of education in Barbados is generally high, with a strong focus on academic achievement and **extracurricular activities**. Public schools are well-funded and well-equipped, with modern facilities and qualified teachers. Private schools, while more expensive, offer a more personalized education and often have smaller class sizes. International schools, meanwhile, provide a global perspective and a range of curricula, making them a popular choice for expat families. Overall, the education system in Barbados is well-regarded and provides students with a solid foundation for future success.

[SECTION] School Fees [/SECTION]
[TABLE]
| School Type | Annual Fee (USD) | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Public Primary | $0 (free) | High-quality education, modern facilities |
| Private Primary | $2,000-$5,000 | Range of prices depending on school and location |
| Public Secondary | $0 (free) | Strong focus on core subjects, **extracurricular activities** |
| Private Secondary | $3,000-$7,000 | Smaller class sizes, more personalized education |
| International School | $6,000-$10,000 | **IB** and **Cambridge** curricula, global perspective |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] Other Education Costs [/SECTION]
[TABLE]

[SECTION] Education Quality & Tips [/SECTION]
- The **University of the West Indies** is a top-ranked institution, with a strong reputation for academic excellence.
- **Scholarships** are available for local and international students, covering a range of programs and fields of study.
- **Online learning** options are becoming increasingly popular, with many institutions offering **distance learning** programs.
- The education system in Barbados is highly regarded, with a strong focus on **academic achievement** and **extracurricular activities**.
- **Expats** should research schools carefully, considering factors such as **curriculum**, **location**, and **reputation**.
- **Language support** is available for international students, with many schools offering **English language courses** and **language support services**.
